text: The availability and caring attitude of the staff the location quiet but in the vicinity of public transport and good restaurants
location cleanliness and comfort great staffs who are willing to check you at earlier time depending on availability and offer good choices for their guests. None
Location was good pool area and availability very good bar and restaurant good value staff very friendly. Noise from the refurbishment car park charges beds very soft and uncomfortable
Staff Availability and Support Location Area Close to Imperial and Museums. Breakfast was very basic
accessibility both sides of the river with plenty of attractions within a good location. only one pillow which was too big would have preferred two smaller ones to enable adjustment
Lovely staff amazing location. Availability Full Fat milk would have been better then skimmed in the room fridge and a mac adapter for the HDMI cable
We were upgraded to a suite having been before and there was availability Superb accommodation spacious well fitted out view over the garden square

Clean good size rooms and bathroom Staff friendly and helpful Good location. Accessibility of hotel on busy road Difficult to reach to find out where to park then to park across the road and then haul bags to reception to check in

Fantastic location in terms of accessibility to St Pancras station Within walking distance 15 minutes of UCL Great sized room contained 2 single beds and a double Microwave fridge iron ironing board hairdryer all provided Good selection of continental breakfast choices. Nothing
Great location Very friendly staff The availability for Handy was a nice surprise The cigar bar downstairs also has characters. A bit pricey
Central location easy accessibility to shops restaurants. cost high for room only The d cor is outdated and bedrooms and common areas need to be refurbished
excellent availability proximity of shops iron refrigerator hair dryer. only a facial towel was available outside the window the air conditioning from the side restaurant was interrupting all night

I stayed here for 5 nights. A budget Bed & Breakfast in Acton, clean rooms and bathroom. Accessibility is the least to be cared about here as it is well connected to North Acton and Acton Town Underground stations. Helpful staff. Morning English breakfast was really good, a wide variety of choices available. The surrounding area is free of any hustle and bustle so extremely good choice for a person looking for a quieter area to stay. Numerous restaurants & take aways present nearby. They provided me with wifi at a very low cost. Many small cooperative stores nearby. Room service provided daily. Only for one night the hot water was not available but the problem was solved the very next morning. I will definitely book this place if and when I visit London in the future

I've already stayed at the Ridgemount on two occasions, for a week in 2011 and for around 10 days last year. I wanted to book for next month again but, sadly, there was no availability on such short notice. What can I say? The staff was always very helpful, the rooms were clean and cosy, comfortable to spend time watching TV or relaxing after the activities of the day. The shared bathroom was always clean as well. I'm a vegetarian and, even though they offered english breakfast, I could always choose to have cereal with soy milk and toasts with strawberry jam instead. There were also a couple of times that I was offered cheese and tomato too. The location is superb, it's near the Northern Line, The Central Line and The Piccadilly Line, being Goodge Street the nearest station (Northern Line), not to mention that you can reach lots of places just by walking.
Modern and clean Great location Friendly staff. Bed too small Lift noise was not good Room too close to lift
Location Breakfast was good and staff were pleasant. The decor generally was rather tired and furniture a little shabby No lift and we were on the top floor Room was in the lift and very warm
Great location right down the block from the tube loved that Nice neighborhood. Odd layout confusing hallways EXTREMELY small elevator lift

The location near to a Piccadilly line tube station is great the hotel is small and personable the staff is very friendly and efficient. The lift is the smallest I have ever been in but at least there is a lift
Central location close to Euston Nice staff good breakfast. no lift
good location close to Victoria Station. poor wi fi no lift
